00053 bool BeeHive::allIdle() {
00054 
00055         //Lock the queue mutex while we check how many jobs are waiting
00056         jobQueueMutex.Lock();
00057 
00058         int size = m_waitingJobs.size();
00059 
00060         //Unlock it once fetching the size is done
00061         jobQueueMutex.Unlock();
00062 
00063         //If there are waiting jobs then everything is definately idle
00064         if (size != 0)
00065                 return false;
00066 
00067         //If not, scan through each bee
00068         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_numberOfBees; ++i) {
00069 
00070                 //If that bee is busy then return false
00071                 if (m_bees[i]->getBeeStatus() != beeIdle) {
00072 
00073                         return false;
00074 
00075                 }
00076 
00077         }
00078 
00079         //if the code reachs here then everythings free
00080         return true;
00081 }

00083 void BeeHive::issueOrders(WorkerJob* newJob) {
00084 
00085         //LOCK ACCESS TO JOB QUEUE/WAIT FOR ANYTHING ELSE TO CLEAR IT
00086         jobQueueMutex.Lock();
00087 
00088         //Add the job
00089         m_waitingJobs.push(newJob);
00090 
00091         //UNLOCK IT SO OTHER PEOPLE CAN HAVE A TURN
00092         jobQueueMutex.Unlock();
00093 
00094 }
00095 
00096 WorkerJob* BeeHive::beeRequestNextJob() {
00097         //LOCK ACCESS TO JOB QUEUE/WAIT FOR ANYTHING TO CLEAR IT
00098         jobQueueMutex.Lock();
00099 
00100         WorkerJob* nextJob = 0;
00101 
00102         //If there are waiting jobs
00103         if (m_waitingJobs.size() != 0) {
00104                 //Get the next job from the queue
00105                 nextJob = m_waitingJobs.front();
00106                 m_waitingJobs.pop();
00107 
00108         }
00109 
00110         //UNLOCK HERE
00111         jobQueueMutex.Unlock();
00112 
00113         //Return the job you got
00114         return nextJob;
00115 }
